description: Representative Dina Titus (D-NV), discusses the release of the Epstein files on the Department of Justice website and the recent US strike in Syria targeting ISIS. She tells Joe Mathieu on the late edition of Bloomberg's “Balance of Power” that covering blacked-out pages signals an attempt to hide information. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Rep. Dina Titus on Epstein Files and US Strike in Syria

description: Former Federal Prosecutor for the Southern District of New York, Jessica Roth, discusses the Department of Justice releasing the first batch of the Jeffrey Epstein files as the deadline is midnight tonight. She states "it's hard to know where to start exactly," and shares her thoughts on the DOJ holding information. Roth also talks about the amount of redactions in the files, what the DOJ's justification will be for these redactions, and if the files will meet the expectations set by US Attorney General Pam Bondi. She speaks with Joe Mathieu on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Hard to Know Where to Start: Roth on Epstein Files

author: Jen Judson
description: The Space Development Agency has awarded L3Harris Technologies a nearly $1 billion contract to build satellites that would bolster a missile tracking layer above Earth, a key element of President Donald Trump’s Golden Dome defense shield.
title: L3Harris Wins US Contract to Bolster Missile Tracking in Space

author: Jen Judson
description: The US launched airstrikes on Syria, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said Friday, fulfilling President Donald Trump’s vow to strike back after the killing of two US soldiers.
title: US Launches Retaliatory Strikes in Syria After Trump Threat

description: The US Justice Department released files from investigations into notorious sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, the culmination of a push that has had repercussions for prominent business leaders and politicians, including President Donald Trump. Megan Scully has more on "Bloomberg The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Justice Department Releases Some Epstein Files

author: Joe Sobczyk
description: The Justice Department’s release had been mandated by Congress.
title: First Batch of Government’s Epstein Files Released

author: Vincent Lee
description: Workers added President Donald Trump’s name to the John F. Kennedy Memorial Center for the Performing Arts on Friday, a day after members of the venue’s board voted for the change despite questions about their legal authority to do so.
title: Kennedy Center Adds Trump’s Name to Sign a Day After Board Vote

author: Nacha Cattan
description: Republican Congresswoman Elise Stefanik, said she’s suspending her campaign to run for New York Governor and won’t seek reelection to Congress.
title: Stefanik Suspends NY Governor Campaign, Won’t Seek Reelection

author: Jamie Tarabay, Catherine Lucey, Chris Strohm
description: The US Justice Department released files from investigations into notorious sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, the culmination of a push that has had repercussions for prominent business leaders and politicians, including President Donald Trump.
title: Justice Department Releases Large Tranche of Epstein Files

description: On today's episode of Bloomberg Businessweek Daily, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec discuss US consumer sentiment rising in December by less than expected, as affordability concerns continue weighing on Americans. Bloomberg's Michael McKee joins the show to break it down. Also on today's show, Amazon Robotics Chief Technologist Tye Brady on the roles robotics and automation are playing in the company's warehouse tasks. Plus, Bloomberg's Simon Casey on the global oil market outlook into 2026 as a glut looks likely. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Consumer Sentiment Subdued Amid Affordability Worries | Bloomberg Businessweek Daily 12/19/2025

description: Tye Brady, chief technologist at Amazon Robotics, says that any physical AI tools or robotics that can help reduce errors in their shipping systems helps during the busy holiday season as the company prepares to ship millions of packages a day. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Amazon Turns to Robotics, Automation to Streamline Busy Holiday Season

author: Courtney Subramanian
description: President Donald Trump said he would convene insurance companies in the coming weeks in a bid to pressure them to reduce costs for Americans who will see their premiums rise following the expiration of Obamacare subsidies at year’s end.
title: Trump to Summon Health Insurers to Ask for Premium Cuts

author: Joe Deaux, Josh Wingrove
description: The Trump administration’s investment in a US zinc development has thrust it into the middle of a South Korean proxy fight, an example of how the government’s push for equity stakes in critical industries is facing free-market blowback.
title: Korean Proxy Fight Threatens to Derail Trump’s Big Zinc Bet

description: President Donald Trump has indicated that Kevin Hassett and Kevin Warsh are his top choices to lead the US Federal Reserve to take over for current chairman Jay Powell.  The president has indicated he wants the next leader of the central bank to more aggressively cut interest rates as he looks to push down mortgage costs. Bloomberg's Michael McKee joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break down the Fed's 2026 outlook amid an impending announcement for a new chair. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: 'Developing a Consensus' Key for Incoming Fed Chair

description: Constitutional lawyer Robert McWhirter says that there is not a clear process to enforce the total release of the Epstein files and that it could be hard to evaluate the 'completeness' of the disclosures by the DOJ.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: DOJ Faces Public Scrutiny Ahead of Epstein Files Release

description: On the early edition of Balance of Power, Bloomberg Washington Correspondent Joe Mathieu discusses the Department of Justices' anticipated release of the Epstein files. On today's show, Partner at Cozen O'Connor Sarah Krissoff, Democracy Visiting Fellow at Harvard Kennedy School's Ash Center Jeanne Sheehan Zaino, Senior Vice President at ROKK Solutions Lisa Camooso Miller, and Host of Wall Street Week David Westin. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: DOJ Set to Release Epstein Files | Balance of Power: Early Edition 12/19/2025

author: Michael O'Boyle, Gonzalo Soto
description: Companies controlled by billionaire Ricardo Salinas Pliego will get a multibillion-dollar tax bill in January, and he will need to pay up or face consequences, Mexico’s President Claudia Sheinbaum said Friday.
title: Billionaire Salinas Faces $2.8 Billion Mexico Tax Claim Showdown

description: Sarah Krissoff, a former federal prosecutor, said some of the most interesting information in the government's Epstein files is likely to come from the reports of witness interviews by FBI agents. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: DOJ Delays Some Epstein Files Ahead of Friday Deadline

author: Maggie Eastland
description: House Republicans are calling for arms-sale style congressional oversight of artificial intelligence chip exports as the Trump administration moves to approve licenses for Nvidia Corp. to ship its H200 processor to China.
title: Congress Revisits Export Curbs in Wake of Trump’s H200 Approval

author: Mathieu Dion
description: The head of fast-fashion retailer Groupe Dynamite Inc. sharply criticized Quebec Premier Francois Legault, threatening again to move the company’s headquarters if the provincial government doesn’t relax its restrictive immigration policies.
title: Dynamite’s CEO Lambastes Quebec Premier Legault Over Immigration

author: Eric Martin, Magdalena Del Valle
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said the US doesn’t want to force a ceasefire deal on Ukraine and said the Trump administration still doesn’t know whether President Vladimir Putin wants to do a deal or take over the entire country.
title: Rubio Says US Doesn’t Want to Force a Ceasefire Deal on Ukraine

author: Emily Birnbaum
description: Democratic lawmakers said they plan to explore “all legal options” after the Justice Department announced it will not release all documents about the disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein by the Friday deadline, threatening to prolong a high-stakes political fight as the midterm elections come into view.
title: Democrats Pledge to Push Back as DOJ Delays Some Epstein Files

author: Eric Martin, Magdalena Del Valle
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio called Venezuela’s cooperation with narco-traffickers and terrorists a direct threat to US national security but declined to say if the US is trying to push President Nicolas Maduro out of power.
title: Rubio Calls Maduro Regime’s Behavior ‘Intolerable’ for the US

author: Laura Nahmias
description: New York City’s Campaign Finance Board is probing whether a group of political action committees that spent more than $20 million supporting Andrew Cuomo’s unsuccessful bid for mayor illegally coordinated with the former governor and his campaign, according to people with knowledge of the investigation.
title: NYC Board Probes Pro-Cuomo PACs Spearheaded by Finance CEOs

author: Eric Martin, Magdalena Del Valle
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said the next step in the Gaza peace process should be naming a board of peace and identifying the group of technocrats who would help run the enclave, as the Trump administration looks to bring fresh momentum into the process.
title: Rubio Says Next Step in Gaza Process Is Naming Board of Peace

author: Ugur Yilmaz
description: Turkey said it has found a crashed drone believed to be Russian-made in western Kocaeli province,  adding to a series of recent security incidents amid rising tensions in the Black Sea region.
title: Turkey Finds Suspected Russian-Made Drone After Recent Shootdown

author: Lucia Kassai
description: The tanker Hyperion, sanctioned by the US for having shipped Russian oil, will likely be the first ship to test President Donald Trump’s naval blockade of Venezuela.
title: Sanctioned Tanker Hyperion to Test Trump’s Blockade of Venezuela

author: Erik Wasson, Caitlin Reilly
description: The Republican-led Congress has left Washington for the year with no agreement to extend Obamacare subsidies, handing Democrats a potent political attack line heading into an election year focused squarely on affordability.
title: Democrats Pounce as Congress Allows Obamacare Premiums to Spike

author: Nacha Cattan, Paulina Cachero
description: New York City lawmakers passed several bills to address the city’s housing crisis, while Mayor Eric Adams’ administration and advocacy groups argued that many of the measures will worsen the problem.
title: NYC Gets New Housing Rules as Adams Warns They’ll Stall Projects

author: Alberto Nardelli, Michael Nienaber, Donato Paolo Mancini, Jorge Valero, Suzanne Lynch
description: The loan deal reinforces Ukraine’s hand in peace talks, but leaves the German chancellor nursing the collapse of his Russian assets plan.
title: How Germany Yielded to EU Reality to Keep Kyiv’s War Effort Alive

author: Olesia Safronova
description: Ukraine hit an oil tanker from Russia’s shadow fleet in the Mediterranean Sea for the first time, a fresh escalation in its drone strikes on ships helping carry barrels for Moscow.
title: Ukraine Hits Shadow Fleet Tanker in Mediterranean for First Time

author: Anthony Halpin
description: President Vladimir Putin said he’s willing to discuss bringing Russia’s war in Ukraine to an end, even as he ruled out changes sought by Kyiv and Europe to a US peace plan drawn up with Moscow.
title: Putin Says Russia Ready to End War Even as He Rejects Compromise

author: Will Standring, Alex Wickham
description: The UK Foreign Office was hacked in October in an attack that British officials suspect was carried out by Chinese state-backed actors.
title: UK Suspects Chinese Involvement in Foreign Office Cyberattack

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Funds strengthen Kyiv’s position as talks to end Russia’s war continue.
title: EU’s €90 Billion Lifeline Buys Ukraine Time in Russia War

author: Cristiane Lucchesi, Vinicius Andrade
description: Bank of America Corp. expects Latin America’s equity capital markets to gain steam next year even as presidential elections in Brazil, Colombia and Peru stir up market volatility.
title: BofA Sees Rate Cuts Fueling Latin America Equity Sales in 2026

author: William Horobin
description: A French parliamentary committee failed to agree on a 2026 budget, pushing discussion on the full fiscal plan into the new year and increasing doubts over how the government can rein in the deficit.
title: France Pushes Budget Talks to 2026, Raising Deficit Doubts

description: The Trump administration halted the US green card lottery program, which it said was used by the suspect in the Brown University shooting and killing of a Massachusetts Institute of Technology professor. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Suspends US Green Card Lottery After Brown, MIT Attacks

author: Katarina Hoije
description: Beninese President Patrice Talon played down the threat posed by plotters of an attempted coup this month and declared that they lacked army or popular support.
title: Benin Leader Dismisses Would-Be Putschists as ‘Small-Time Thugs’

author: Kati Pohjanpalo
description: Bank of Finland Governor Olli Rehn called on the Nordic country’s government to decide on more measures to fix its ailing public finances.
title: Bank of Finland’s Rehn Calls for Action to Fix Finnish Deficit

description:
On today's show, the European Union agreed to provide Ukraine with a €90 billion loan for 2026-2027, aiming to keep the country afloat and strengthen its negotiating position. It comes as the US pushes ahead with peace talks.

The BOJ hiked its benchmark rate by a quarter point to 0.75%, the highest level in three decades, as expected. The central bank said it will keep raising rates if the economy and price outlooks are realized.

TikTok signed agreements with investors including Oracle, Silver Lake and MGX for a new US joint venture that makes the app majority-owned by American investors. Oracle rose post-market.

Nike, the world's largest sportswear company, saw its shares fall more than 10% in after-market trading.

Today's guests: Fuse Energy CEO & Co-Founder Alan Chang

'Correct: Graphic has been edited at 00;41;42;15 to reflect that GfK conducted the survey about Britons being more likely to buy big-ticket items' (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Ukraine Deal: EU Agrees To €90B Loan Without Using Russian Assets | Daybreak Europe 12/19/2025

author: Lucille Liu, Catherine Wong
description: China reiterated that US weapons sales to Taiwan raise the chances of a clash between the superpowers — underscoring its displeasure after Washington approved a deal worth up to $11 billion.
title: China Points to Risk of Clash With US After Taiwan Arms Package

description: European Union leaders reached an agreement to loan Ukraine €90 billion ($106 billion) for the next two years, aiming to strengthen Kyiv’s hand at the negotiating table and keep the war-torn country afloat. The EU will raise joint debt backed by the bloc’s budget to fund the loan, a significant pivot from using frozen Russian assets, a plan favored by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy. Bloomberg's Oliver Crook reports. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: EU's €90 Billion Loan to Ukraine Won't Use Frozen Russian Assets

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has thanked EU leaders after the European Council agreed to provide 90 billion euros (£78.8 billion) in financial support for Ukraine.
title: Zelensky Welcomes £78.8 Billion EU Backing for Ukraine

author: Ramsey Al-Rikabi
description: The Trump administration halted the US green card lottery program, which it said was used by the suspect in the Brown University shooting and killing of a Massachusetts Institute of Technology professor.
title: Trump Suspends US Green Card Lottery After Brown, MIT Attacks

author: John Harney, Chelsea Mes
description: The White House website was disrupted late Thursday night when a live stream showing a bearded young man wearing headphones and sitting in front of a microphone appeared.
title: Mystery Video Stream Appears on White House Website

author: Ellen Milligan
description: NATO militaries currently lack the resilience for a protracted conflict, the alliance’s top maritime commander warned, reinforcing concern that Europe isn’t yet prepared for a long-term confrontation with Russia.
title: NATO Lacks Resilience to Fight a Long War, Naval Chief Warns

author: Arun Devnath
description: Violence swept through parts of Bangladesh after the murder of a prominent activist behind the 2024 mass uprising, deepening concerns about the South Asian country’s fragile political transition.
title: Bangladesh Violence Erupts After Murder of 2024 Uprising Leader

author: Ania Nussbaum, Alberto Nardelli
description: French President Emmanuel Macron said Europe will have to find the way to directly engage with the Russian leader as the US pushes ahead with peace talks.
title: Macron Says Europe Will Have to Reach Out to Putin Over Ukraine

author: Toru Fujioka
description: The Bank of Japan raised its benchmark interest rate to the highest in 30 years and said more increases are in the pipeline if conditions allow, in a sign of growing conviction that it can attain the stable inflation target it has pursued for more than a decade.
title: Bank of Japan Hikes Benchmark Rate to Highest Level Since 1995

author: Stephen Stapczynski
description: A liquefied natural gas tanker linked to a Chinese company docked at a US-sanctioned Russian export project for the first time, the latest step by Moscow and Beijing to strengthen energy ties and skirt western curbs.
title: China-Linked LNG Ship Docks at US-Sanctioned Russia Export Plant

author: Alberto Nardelli, Jorge Valero
description: European Union leaders reached an agreement to loan Ukraine €90 billion ($106 billion) for the next two years, aiming to strengthen Kyiv’s hand at the negotiating table and keep the war-torn country afloat.
title: EU Agrees to €90 Billion Loan for Ukraine for 2026-2027

author: Lydia Beyoud
description: The US Senate on Thursday night confirmed Michael Selig as chairman of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission and Travis Hill as chairman of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp., installing permanent chiefs of two agencies that play critical roles overseeing financial markets and banks.
title: Senate Confirms Selig as Chief of CFTC and Hill to Run the FDIC

description: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Rep. Nick LaLota (R-NY) states that he supports the extension of ACA credits for the short term, but discusses what changes need to happen in the long term. Rep. Melanie Stansbury (D-NM) on if she expects the DOJ to release the Jeffrey Epstein files as the deadline is Friday. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: ByteDance Signed Agreements to Create New US Joint Venture | Balance of Power: Late Edition 12/18/25

author: Sakura Murakami
description: A senior government official who advises Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi on security expressed a personal opinion that Japan should have nuclear weapons, according to local media reports.
title: Japan Should Have Nuclear Weapons, Official Reportedly Says

author: Laura Davison
description: Bonus checks. New holidays. A return to the moon.
title: Trump Rolls Out a Flurry of Perks While Political Strains Mount

author: Alberto Nardelli, Jorge Valero, Andrea Palasciano
description: The European Union is considering a plan to use joint debt to loan as much as €90 billion ($106 billion) to Ukraine, according to a draft proposal seen by Bloomberg.
title: EU Weighs Using Joint Debt to Loan Up to $106 billion Billion to Ukraine

description: Rep. Melanie Stansbury (D-NM) voices her frustration about Speaker Johnson letting his members leave town when there is still time to discuss the continuing issues surrounding American health care. Representative Stansbury also talks about whether or not she believes there will be a government shutdown next month and if she expects the DOJ to release the Jeffrey Epstein files as the deadline is Friday. She speaks with Joe Mathieu on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Could Discharge Petition Shift Senate on Health Care?
